name: Alegria Oceanfront Inn and Cottages

reviews.title: Perfect Spot!
reviews.text: Spent four nights in September at the "Farm" rental which is located two blocks from the Inn. Found the unit to be much larger than those at the Inn, which was great for an extended stay. Breakfast was not included, but the unit has a full kitchen. The staff at the Inn couldn't be more helpful and always pleasant. Would highly recommend this unit for a great value on a longer stay in beautiful Mendocino!

reviews.title: Perfect!
reviews.text: Just returned from a great couple of days in Mendocino where we stayed at Alegria. We couldn't have been happier with the owners' hospitality, the lovely (and very clean) room, and the unique and delicious breakfasts (a fantastic souffle and homemade coffee cake one morning, orange pancakes with orange maple syrup, along with chicken apple sausage the next). Our room (like pretty much all of them, it seems) had a terrific water view; the gardens are beautiful and every amenity has been thought of here. The location is terrific for Mendocino -- extremely walkable to beach, shops and restaurants while slightly set back off the road so you have a sense of privacy as well. Highly recommended!

Our first trip to Mendocino was made so much more enjoyable when we had a unique, picturesque and friendly place to call "home" for three nights. Coming from an oceanfront community on the East Coast to this inn on the ocean only confirms the fact that when your first sight of the day is a sea-green rolling tide (on one day) and a mysterious mist riding the waves (on our two other days) it doesn't get any better than that!
reviews.title: Giving an A to Alegria

reviews.text: Our stay in the Garden Cove Cottage was wonderful...a private retreat among the fragrant gardens and only a stroll to a old wooden two seater swing to watch the tide roll over the sandbars. Down a easy sloping trail - and Voila! your own beach! The cottage was a beautiful, rustic but majestic, with cedar beams and walls and a woodstove. Fridge, utensils, glasses of all types, plentiful drawer space, table and chairs, comfy bed and a spacious walk-in shower complete with heater. Thoughful extras like fresh local coffee for your room (not the pre-packages type), cream, chocolates, fresh flowers and a personalized welcome note.
reviews.title: Relaxing retreat

reviews.text: Outside we had our very own private deck with lounge chairs and table where we sat into the peaceful nights drinking wine (surprise gift in the fridge) and eating local cheeses, apples and bread.
reviews.title: Not worth the money
The best in Mendocino.
reviews.text: Breakfasts were first rate. Varied, plentiful, (with seconds offered) (awesome pumpkin pancakes!)using local organic foods and juices. Fresh flowers from the gardens adorned the table and our plates to go along with the view from the dining area which overlooks the gardens all the way down to the beach.

The inn was full while we were there, but not a peep was heard. It was very quiet and relaxing, as if you had your own private place on the coast. We didn't get a chance to partake in the hot tub...we'll save that for next time!
reviews.title: Wouldn't recommend for the price

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Cove Cottage for three nights and couldn't have had a more perfect place to unwind and cocoon. Eric and Elaine were thoughtful, friendly but not intrusive. We had their beautiful breakfasts brought to our room each morning. The view from the Cove Cottage is breathtaking and the path down to the beach made it seem like our own private paradise. Please be advised that while the bathroom is comfortable, the shower is very small so if you are into luxurious bathrooms, the Cove Cottage might not be the room for you. For us, the view and the seclusion made it the perfect spot. I highly recommend it.
reviews.title: The perfect cocoon!
Alegria was fantastic!
reviews.text: My husband and I celebrated our 5th wedding anniversary in Mendocino and stayed at Alegria. We could not have asked for a better place to stay. The owners (Elaine and Eric) were wonderful hosts, and their breakfasts were incredible--they were even willing to share their recipes! (Another B&B that we stayed at in Calistoga refused to share their breakfast recipes with us so it was notable for me to have Elaine offer to share any of her recipes.) The views from our room (Seabreeze) were spectacular and the beach access was wonderful. Our room was not the most luxurious room we've stayed in (a bit small, wash basin was a bit old and in the main room instead of bathroom) but the level of service and everything else about the inn made our weekend very special. We would definitely recommend Alegria to others.

reviews.title: Restful and relaxing
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay at the Alegria Inn. Our room, Treehouse, was very large and private with a very nice fireplace that we used each night. The only drawback was that the bathroom was not very luxurious, but it did have a view of the ocean from the shower! I would definitely stay again, but I would try another room, probably Cove Cottage. Our breakfasts were delicious, and access to the ocean was relatively convenient.

reviews.title: Love this place!
reviews.text: Also, just a note not to visit in January... nothing was wrong with Alegria Inn, but a few of the restaurants that we would have liked to visit were closed.

reviews.title: Hard to Describe the Experience!
reviews.text: Not chi-chi, but terribly comfortable and the friendliest B&B in Mendocino. Everything has a lived in, warm, casual appeal. Most rooms have ocean views, all are a stroll down a private path to a secluded beach, and in close walking distance to Mendocino's great cafes and shops. Great breakfast too -- Elaine is an excellent and inventive cook. Not only do owners Eric and Elaine and their staff feed you and advise you on the sights, they leave you a bottle of good wine (not the cheap stuff!) and chocolates and multiple varieties of organic teas and coffees. Your choice of down or nonallergenic bedding, and lovely latex mattresses that are perfect for your back.

aka: Alegria Oceanfront Inn And Cottages Hotel
